data.title: Douglas L. Jackson
data.meta_description: Douglas L. Jackson devotes much of his time to litigation for major corporations and individuals. data.text:
Douglas L. Jackson devotes much of his time to litigation for major corporations and individuals. He practices in the areas of commercial, civil litigation and debtor and creditor law. He represents banks, agricultural cooperatives, insurance companies and many agricultural clients. Jackson has drafted language for legislation, which later became law.

Born in Hobart, Oklahoma, he has a bachelor of science in agricultural economics from Oklahoma State University, where he was the top male graduate in his class. He earned his law degree from Washington College of Law, in Washington, D.C.

He is past president of the Northwest District Livestock Show and the Oakwood Country Club.
